definitions.definition: To work on a farm, especially in the growing and harvesting of crops.
To give up to another, as an estate, a business, the revenue, etc., on condition of receiving in return a percentage of what it yields; to farm out.
To lease or let for an equivalent, e.g. land for a rent; to yield the use of to proceeds.
To take at a certain rent or rate.
To engage in grinding (repetitive activity) in a particular area or against specific enemies for a particular drop or item.
To cleanse; clean out; put in order; empty; empty out
definitions.example: Farm out the stable and pigsty.

definitions.definition: The business of cultivating land, raising stocks etc.
A farming operation; a farm, or instance of farming on a piece of land.
